concept.title: Application server configuration
concept.shortdesc: You can configure an application server either by using the Ant configure target, or by using the administrative console.

conbody.p: Before you configure the application server, you must install for . For more information, see .

Use one of the following methods to configure an application server:
By using the Ant configure target. This approach applies to simple single-cell test environments.
By using the administrative console as described in . This approach applies to more complex clustered environments. A number of Ant targets are available to help you configure and deploy as described in the following topics.
The Ant configure target that is provided by represents a simple default configuration and might not be suitable for a production environment.
conbody.note:
On for the only profile available is the default profile. No other option is possible.
Therefore, before you configure the application server, either by using the Ant configure target or the administrative console, back up the configuration file system in case you need to rerun the configuration process.
